Now I have read all four files. Let me compile a comprehensive verification report. --- # SPLICE CEP Plugin Settings Management and UI Logic Verification Report ## Overall Verdict: **PASS WITH ISSUES** --- ## 1. Settings Management ### 1.1 DEFAULT_SETTINGS Completeness **Status: PASS** The `DEFAULT_SETTINGS` object in `config.js` (lines 395-423) is comprehensive and includes: ```javascript const DEFAULT_SETTINGS = { sensitivity: 50, minSilenceLength: 0.5, sourceIsolated: false, enableTakesDetection: true, enableJCut: false, jcutLeadIn: 0.3, jcutLeadOut: 0.2, enableZoom: false, zoomFrequency: 'medium', zoomPreset: 'medium', zoomPlacement: 'sentence_start', enableChapters: false, maxChapters: 10, minChapterLength: 60, enableProfanity: false, profanityLanguage: 'en', bleepType: 'standard', // Authentication customerId: null, licenseKey: null, accessToken: null, refreshToken: null, tokenExpiry: null, // UI State expandedOptions: false, activePreset: 'podcast', rememberOptions: false }; ``` **Findings:** - All detection features have default values - Authentication tokens properly initialized to null - UI state settings included ### 1.2 saveSettings() with Encryption **Status: PASS** Located at lines 610-621 in `config.js`: ```javascript function saveSettings(settings) { try { const current = getSettings(); const merged = { ...current, ...settings }; return _saveSettingsInternal(merged); } catch (e) { console.warn('[Config] Error saving settings:', e); return false; } } ``` The internal function `_saveSettingsInternal()` (lines 556-571) properly: - Encrypts sensitive fields via `encryptSensitiveFields()` - Adds storage version marker - Stores to localStorage as JSON ### 1.3 getSettings() with Decryption and Migration **Status: PASS** Located at lines 577-604 in `config.js`: ```javascript function getSettings() { try { const stored = localStorage.getItem('spliceSettings'); if (stored) { const parsed = JSON.parse(stored); const decrypted = decryptSensitiveFields(parsed); // Migration logic for legacy data if (!parsed._storageVersion) { debugLog('[Config] Migrating legacy settings to encrypted format'); const migratedSettings = { ...DEFAULT_SETTINGS, ...decrypted }; _saveSettingsInternal(migratedSettings); } const result = { ...DEFAULT_SETTINGS, ...decrypted }; delete result._storageVersion; return result; } } catch (e) { console.warn('[Config] Error loading settings:', e); } return { ...DEFAULT_SETTINGS }; } ``` **Findings:** - Properly decrypts sensitive fields - Handles migration from unversioned (legacy) storage - Falls back to defaults on error - Removes internal `_storageVersion` field from returned object ### 1.4 SENSITIVE_FIELDS List **Status: PASS** Located at line 429 in `config.js`: ```javascript const SENSITIVE_FIELDS = ['customerId', 'licenseKey', 'accessToken', 'refreshToken']; ``` **Findings:** - All authentication tokens are included - `customerId` included (contains Stripe customer ID) - `licenseKey` included - Both `accessToken` and `refreshToken` JWT tokens included ### 1.5 Storage Version Migration **Status: PASS** - `SETTINGS_STORAGE_VERSION = 2` defined at line 426 - Migration handled in `getSettings()` when `_storageVersion` is missing - Internal `_saveSettingsInternal()` adds version marker before storing --- ## 2. Preset System ### 2.1 PRESETS Definitions **Status: PASS** Located at lines 791-889 in `config.js`. All expected presets are defined: | Preset | Sensitivity | minSilenceLength | J-Cut | Description | |--------|-------------|------------------|-------|-------------| | custom | N/A | N/A | N/A | User-defined | | podcast | 35 | 0.8s | Yes | Conservative, longer pauses | | interview | 50 | 0.5s | Yes | Balanced | | reaction | 70 | 0.3s | No | Fast-paced | | tutorial | 30 | 1.0s | Yes | Preserves teaching pace | | vlog | 65 | 0.35s | No | Punchy edits | Each preset includes: sensitivity, threshold, minSilenceLength, paddingStart, paddingEnd, enableTakesDetection, enableJCut, jCutLeadIn, jCutLeadOut. ### 2.2 applyPreset() Updates All Relevant Controls **Status: PASS WITH ISSUES** There are **two implementations** of `applyPreset()`: 1. **config.js** (lines 927-951): Saves settings to storage 2. **main.js** (lines 532-583): Updates UI elements The main.js version properly updates: - Sensitivity slider and value display - enableJCut checkbox and jcutSettings visibility - jCutLeadIn and jCutLeadOut slider values **Issue Found:** - The `enableTakesDetection` checkbox is NOT updated by the `applyPreset()` function in main.js, even though preset settings include it. **Recommendation:** Add this to main.js `applyPreset()`: ```javascript if (ui.enableTakesDetection && settings.enableTakesDetection !== undefined) { ui.enableTakesDetection.checked = settings.enableTakesDetection; } ``` ### 2.3 Custom Preset Handling **Status: PASS** Both implementations correctly handle the custom preset: - Returns early without modifying settings (except setting `activePreset: 'custom'`) - config.js line 936-939: `if (presetName === 'custom' || !preset.settings)` - main.js line 537-541: `if (presetId === 'custom' || !preset.settings)` ### 2.4 Preset Selector Initialization **Status: PASS** Two initialization functions exist: 1. **config.js `initPresetSelector()`** (lines 965-1022): More comprehensive, includes: - Setting initial value from stored settings - Handling preset change to update all controls - Switching to 'custom' when user manually changes sensitivity 2. **main.js `initPresetSelector()`** (lines 517-530): Simpler version Both are called during initialization (main.js line 145 calls `initPresetSelector()` from config.js). --- ## 3. UI Controls ### 3.1 Sensitivity Slider and Value Display **Status: PASS** In main.js `initSliders()` (lines 433-458): ```javascript if (ui.sensitivitySlider && ui.sensitivityValue) { ui.sensitivitySlider.addEventListener('input', () => { ui.sensitivityValue.textContent = ui.sensitivitySlider.value; saveSettings({ sensitivity: parseInt(ui.sensitivitySlider.value) }); }); } ``` HTML properly structured (index.html lines 54-62): ```html
``` ### 3.2 Checkbox States **Status: PASS** All checkboxes properly initialized in `loadSettingsToUI()` (main.js lines 588-617): - `enableTakesDetection` (line 596) - `enableJCut` (line 597) - `enableZoom` (line 598) - `enableChapters` (line 599) - `enableProfanity` - handled in `initFeatureToggles()` State changes properly saved via `initFeatureToggles()` (lines 463-510). ### 3.3 Collapsible Sections **Status: PASS** Properly implemented for: - Options panel (main.js lines 326-349) - J-Cut settings (lines 465-470) - Zoom settings (lines 473-478) - Chapter settings (lines 481-485) - Profanity settings (lines 496-501) - Filler settings (lines 504-509) - Text Editor panel (lines 354-378) - Social Reframe panel (lines 383-403) - Music panel (lines 408-428) All use the pattern: ```javascript panel.classList.toggle('collapsed', !checkbox.checked); ``` ### 3.4 Button Enable/Disable Logic **Status: PASS** - `goBtn` disabled during operations (line 658, 891) - `applyMultitrackBtn` starts disabled (index.html line 278) - `text-editor-undo-btn` and `text-editor-redo-btn` start disabled (lines 365-368) - `text-editor-build-btn` starts disabled (line 402) - `removeFillersBtn` starts disabled (line 183) - Offline detection disables `goBtn` via `updateOfflineUI()` (config.js lines 680-698) --- ## 4. Credit Display ### 4.1 fetchCredits() with JWT Auth **Status: PASS** Located in credits.js (lines 23-119): ```javascript async function fetchCredits() { // Ensure valid token before request if (typeof ensureValidToken === 'function') { const hasValidToken = await ensureValidToken(); // Falls back to legacy auth if no JWT } const response = await fetchWithTimeout(`${getBackendUrl()}/credits`, { method: 'GET', headers: getAuthHeaders() // Uses JWT Bearer token }, SPLICE_CONFIG.FETCH_TIMEOUT); // ... } ``` ### 4.2 Token Refresh on 401 **Status: PASS** Implemented in credits.js lines 52-88: ```javascript if (response.status === 401 && typeof refreshAccessToken === 'function') { debugLog('[Credits] Got 401, attempting token refresh...'); const refreshed = await refreshAccessToken(); if (refreshed) { // Retry with new token const retryResponse = await fetchWithTimeout(...); // ... } // If refresh fails, clear tokens and require re-login if (typeof clearAuthTokens === 'function') { clearAuthTokens(); } return { _error: true, message: 'Session expired. Please log in again.' }; } ``` ### 4.3 Credit Badge States **Status: PASS** All states implemented in `updateCreditDisplay()` (credits.js lines 135-202): | State | Class | Text | Condition | |-------|-------|------|-----------| | Login | `login` | "Login" | No credits/customerId | | Error | `error` | "Retry" | `credits._error` | | OK | `ok` | "X.X hrs" | Normal state | | Low | `low` | "X.X hrs" | `hoursRemaining <= 1` | | Trial | `trial` | "Trial: Xd" | `isOnTrial && trialDaysRemaining` | ### 4.4 Tier-Based Feature Access **Status: PASS** Implemented in credits.js: - `hasFeatureAccess(featureName)` (lines 287-292) - `getRequiredTier(featureName)` (lines 299-309) - `updateIsolationCheckboxState(credits)` (lines 207-230) - `checkIsolationAccess(estimatedMinutes)` (lines 238-273) Feature tier mapping properly defined: ```javascript const teamOnlyFeatures = ['multitrack', 'music_to_cut', 'mood_timeline', 'youtube_metadata', 'profanity_bleeping']; const proFeatures = ['vocal_isolation', 'social_reframe', 'text_editing', 'all_captions', 'profanity_detection', 'chapter_detection']; ``` --- ## 5. Form Validation ### 5.1 License Key Format Validation **Status: PASS** Located in config.js `isValidLicenseKeyFormat()` (lines 1032-1037): ```javascript function isValidLicenseKeyFormat(key) { if (!key || typeof key !== 'string') return false; const normalized = key.toUpperCase().trim(); const pattern = /^SPLICE-[ABCDEFGHJKMNPQRSTUVWXYZ23456789]{4}-[ABCDEFGHJKMNPQRSTUVWXYZ23456789]{4}-[ABCDEFGHJKMNPQRSTUVWXYZ23456789]{4}$/; return pattern.test(normalized); } ``` **Findings:** - Properly excludes confusing characters (0/O, 1/I/L) - Validates format: SPLICE-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX - Input normalized to uppercase and trimmed ### 5.2 Email Format Validation **Status: PASS** Located in config.js line 1192-1193 and main.js lines 1439-1444: ```javascript const emailRegex = /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/; if (!emailRegex.test(email)) { showLoginError('Please enter a valid email address'); return; } ``` ### 5.3 Input Sanitization **Status: PASS** Input values are trimmed and normalized: - License key: `licenseKeyInput?.value?.trim()?.toUpperCase()` (line 1082) - Email: `lookupEmailInput?.value?.trim()?.toLowerCase()` (line 1185, main.js 1433) ### 5.4 XSS Prevention (escapeHtml) **Status: PASS** Located in config.js (lines 710-725): ```javascript function escapeHtml(str) { if (str === null || str === undefined) return ''; if (typeof str !== 'string') str = String(str); const escapeMap = { '&': '&', '<': '<', '>': '>', '"': '"', "'": ''', '/': '/', '`': '`' }; return str.replace(/[&<>"'\/`]/g, char => escapeMap[char]); } ``` **Usage verified:** - Chapter titles escaped (main.js line 1045): `const safeTitle = escapeHtml(chapter.title)` - Take labels escaped (main.js line 969): `const safeLabel = escapeHtml(take.label || ...)` Also includes `safeHtml()` template literal function (lines 733-739). --- ## 6. Event Handlers ### 6.1 No Duplicate Event Listeners **Status: PASS WITH ISSUES** **Issue Found:** There is a potential for duplicate credit badge click handlers: 1. **config.js** `initLoginModal()` (lines 1051-1060): Adds click handler to creditBadge 2. **main.js** `initModals()` (lines 1308-1320): Adds another click handler to creditBadge Both files add event listeners to `creditBadge`. While the main.js version checks for `handleCreditBadgeClick` function first, both handlers will fire. **Recommendation:** Remove the duplicate handler in main.js `initModals()` since `initLoginModal()` from config.js already handles this properly, or ensure only one is attached. **Other Event Listeners:** No other duplicates found. The codebase properly: - Uses cached UI elements (`ui.` object) - Attaches listeners in initialization functions called once ### 6.2 Proper Cleanup on Unload **Status: PASS** - `cleanupCredits()` function exists (credits.js lines 335-340) to clear the refresh interval - `creditsRefreshInterval` properly cleared before being reassigned (credits.js lines 317-319) **Note:** However, `cleanupCredits()` is exported but there's no visible `beforeunload` or similar event handler calling it. **Recommendation:** Add cleanup on panel close: ```javascript window.addEventListener('beforeunload', () => { cleanupCredits(); if (offlineCheckInterval) clearInterval(offlineCheckInterval); }); ``` ### 6.3 Debouncing Where Needed **Status: PASS** - `debounce()` function properly implemented (config.js lines 771-781) - Selection change event debounced (main.js lines 243-259): ```javascript if (window._selectionChangeTimeout) { clearTimeout(window._selectionChangeTimeout); } window._selectionChangeTimeout = setTimeout(async () => { // ... }, 200); ``` --- ## Summary of Issues Found ### Critical Issues None ### High Priority Issues 1. **Duplicate credit badge click handlers** - Both config.js and main.js attach click handlers to the same element ### Medium Priority Issues 2. **enableTakesDetection not updated by preset** - When applying a preset in main.js, the Takes Detection checkbox is not updated to match the preset settings 3. **Missing cleanup on unload** - `cleanupCredits()` exists but is never called on panel close ### Low Priority Issues 4. **Redundant code** - Two implementations of `applyPreset()` and `initPresetSelector()` exist across config.js and main.js --- ## Requirements Checklist | Requirement | Status | Notes | |-------------|--------|-------| | DEFAULT_SETTINGS completeness | PASS | All fields present | | saveSettings() with encryption | PASS | Encrypts sensitive fields | | getSettings() with decryption/migration | PASS | Handles legacy data | | SENSITIVE_FIELDS includes tokens | PASS | All auth tokens included | | Storage version migration | PASS | Version 2 with migration logic | | PRESETS definitions | PASS | All 6 presets defined | | applyPreset() updates controls | PARTIAL | Missing enableTakesDetection update | | Custom preset handling | PASS | Correctly preserves user settings | | Preset selector initialization | PASS | Properly initialized | | Sensitivity slider | PASS | Value display updates | | Checkbox states | PASS | All properly managed | | Collapsible sections | PASS | All working correctly | | Button enable/disable | PASS | Proper state management | | fetchCredits() with JWT | PASS | Uses Bearer token | | Token refresh on 401 | PASS | Automatic refresh | | Credit badge states | PASS | All 5 states implemented | | Tier-based feature access | PASS | Properly gated | | License key validation | PASS | Format validated | | Email validation | PASS | Regex validation | | Input sanitization | PASS | Trim/normalize | | XSS prevention | PASS | escapeHtml used | | No duplicate event listeners | PARTIAL | Credit badge has duplicates | | Proper cleanup on unload | PARTIAL | Function exists but not called | | Debouncing | PASS | Properly implemented | --- ## Recommended Fixes ### Fix 1: Remove duplicate credit badge handler (main.js) **File:** `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep/panel/js/main.js` **Lines:** 1308-1320 Remove or comment out the duplicate handler in `initModals()`: ```javascript // Credit badge click handler - HANDLED BY initLoginModal() in config.js // if (ui.creditBadge) { // ui.creditBadge.addEventListener('click', () => { // // ... // }); // } ``` ### Fix 2: Update enableTakesDetection in applyPreset (main.js) **File:** `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep/panel/js/main.js` **Location:** After line 551 in `applyPreset()` Add: ```javascript if (ui.enableTakesDetection && settings.enableTakesDetection !== undefined) { ui.enableTakesDetection.checked = settings.enableTakesDetection; } ``` ### Fix 3: Add cleanup on unload (main.js) **File:** `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep/panel/js/main.js` **Location:** At end of file or in DOMContentLoaded Add: ```javascript window.addEventListener('beforeunload', () => { if (typeof cleanupCredits === 'function') { cleanupCredits(); } if (typeof offlineCheckInterval !== 'undefined' && offlineCheckInterval) { clearInterval(offlineCheckInterval); } }); ```
